definition: strong/powerful/better/slightly more than/vigorous/violent/best in their category, e.g. see 百強|百强[bai3 qiang2]
to force/to compel/to strive/to make an effort

sentences.english: The Anfield boss believes the trio's return will keep everyone in his squad on their toes.
sentences.chinese: 贝帅相信三员大将的回归将给全队注入一针强心剂。

sentences.english: I'm like a junkie wanting a proper fix these days.
sentences.chinese: 我这些天就像个瘾君子一样等着给我来支强心剂。

sentences.english: It is undoubtedly a strong impetus to the Chinese fashion field.
sentences.chinese: 对中国的时尚圈来说，这无疑于一针强心剂。

sentences.english: The Queensland floods are giving a shot in the arm to steel prices.
sentences.chinese: 昆士兰洪灾给钢铁价格打了一针强心剂。

sentences.english: Fresh signs of strong economic expansion in China also added to market strength Monday.
sentences.chinese: 强劲的经济扩张迹象为周一到市场注入了强心剂。

sentences.english: That would be a long-term commitment that would give confidence to the market.
sentences.chinese: 这将是一个长远的承诺，可以给市场注入强心剂。

definition: heart-strengthening shot/fig. a shot in the arm
tranquilizer/sth that sets one's mind at ease
lit. to inject chicken blood/(coll.) extremely excited or energetic (often used mockingly)
to stir oneself up/to raise one's spirits/to inspire
(one's) last straw to clutch at/one's last hope
variant of 復甦|复苏[fu4 su1]/to recover (health, economic)/to resuscitate/anabiosis
to rise from the dead (idiom); fig. an unexpected recovery
